messages.subject: Re: If there...
messages.msgSnippet: I advocate a movie on the women of Aizu and ofcourse a definite Shinsengumi tie in...Often we see strong women in Hollywood but they are usually eye candy
messages.messageBody:
I advocate a movie on the women of Aizu and ofcourse a definite
Shinsengumi tie in...Often we see "strong" women in Hollywood but
they are usually eye candy for men....what we do know from history
is that women like Nakano Takeko was a serious martial artist,
literate and indeed beautiful...so LAST SAMURAI missed its golden
opportunity to portray Satsuma samurai women (who are shown in many
paintings)...now in Last Samurai disc 2 Tom Cruise claimed to have
done som reading...if so how did they miss Satsuma's samurai women?

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ_Spy_Division] If there...
messages.msgSnippet: I like your idea!!! Will be really great!!! The japanese culture is so amazing....everybody (from around the world!!) should know about Shinsengumi´s
messages.messageBody:
I like your idea!!! Will be really great!!! The japanese culture is so amazing....everybody (from around the world!!) should know about Shinsengumi�s history!! All this "japanese wave" is so exciting.....The Last Samurai is just the begining of a new "japanese era" in Hollywood!....

..::Yuka::..

akayama_kaoru <akayama_kaoru@...> wrote:

If there was a Shinsengumi movie in America, which movie company
should make it? I'd suggest the guys who did the Last Samurai.
Wasn't it Warner Bros.?

I'd love to send this Shinsengumi movie suggestion to any of the
companies by email or something...

Well, there's probably other studios, too. Maybe the guys who
handled Lord of the Rings? Anyone who's good at HISTORICAL research
should do it... although it might be kind of complicated to...
because most of the actors, it would just make more sense if they
were Japanese.

*shrug* Just wanna see what anyone else thought. Maybe I'm
daydreaming all over again.
